alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:07PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Atlantic, Camden, and Gloucester. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 904 PM EDT, the gauge along the Great Egg Harbor River at Folsom remained above flood stage. This is in response to the 4 to 6 inches of rain that fell over the weekend. The gauge has crested, however water levels are expected to remain above flood stage through tonight. - For Great Egg Harbor at Folsom: At 8:45pm the stage was 6.18 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
